we calcuated the slope m which is 0.8

now we will calculate constant c , to calculate the constant c we use the below expression

y = mx + c

where y , m and x are known.

But here we have to take the mean of y and mean of x in the above equation ( y = mx+c)

the expression becomes

(mean of y)  = m*(mean of x) +c

where
mean of y = 2.8

mean of x= 3

slope m = 0.8

2.8 = 0.8*3 + c

c = 2.8  - 2.4

c = 0.4
